metadata.Title: CVE-2020-10134 on Ubuntu 21.04 (hirsute) - medium.
metadata.Description: Pairing in BluetoothÂ® Core v5.2 and earlier may permit an unauthenticated attacker to acquire credentials with two pairing devices via adjacent access when the unauthenticated user initiates different pairing methods in each peer device and an end-user erroneously completes both pairing procedures with the MITM using the confirmation number of one peer as the passkey of the other. An adjacent, unauthenticated attacker could be able to initiate any Bluetooth operation on either attacked device exposed by the enabled Bluetooth profiles. This exposure may be limited when the user must authorize certain access explicitly, but so long as a user assumes that it is the intended remote device requesting permissions, device-local protections may be weakened.

notes.Note: seth-arnold> This appears to be a flaw in the protocol; it's possible that any "fixes" for this issue may be strictly user-interface messages to the user. mdeslaur> no software fix available as of 2021-12-08

criterions.comment: bluez package in hirsute is affected, but a decision has been made to defer addressing it.
